intro: Pleonotoma variabilis var. jacquini, commonly known as the Jacquini's pleonotoma, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
